Package gui

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    Robot
    This interface specifies methods to operate a robot that is inside a maze at a particular location and looking in a particular direction.
    RobotDriver
    This interface specifies a robot driver that operates a robot to escape from a given maze.
    State
    The state interface is used for the controller such that all states of the UI conform and can be treated the same way.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    BasicRobot  
    BasicRobotTest  
    Constants
    This class contains all constants that are used in the maze package and shared among several classes.
    Controller
    Class handles the user interaction.
    DefaultState
    This is a default implementation of the State interface with methods that do nothing but providing runtime exceptions such that subclasses of this class can selectively override those methods that are truly needed.
    FirstPersonDrawer
    This class encapsulates all functionality for drawing the current view at the maze from a first person perspective.
    ManualDriver  
    ManualDriverTest  
    MapDrawer
    This class encapsulates all functionality to draw a map of the overall maze, the set of visible walls, the solution.
    MazeApplication
    This class is a wrapper class to startup the Maze game as a Java application This code is refactored code from Maze.java by Paul Falstad, www.falstad.com, Copyright (C) 1998, all rights reserved Paul Falstad granted permission to modify and use code for teaching purposes.
    MazeFileReader
    This class provides functionality to read the content of a Maze object from a file.
    MazeFileWriter
    This class provides functionality to write a maze configuration to a file in an XML format.
    MazePanel
    Add functionality for double buffering to an AWT Panel class.
    MazeView
    Implements the screens that are displayed whenever the game is not in the playing state.
    Project3Tests  
    RangeSet
    Class stores a set of ranges, i.e., intervals.
    SimpleKeyListener
    Class implements a translation for the user input handled by the MazeController class.
    StateGenerating
    Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the second stage where the user sees a progress bar while a maze is generated by the factory.
    StatePlaying
    Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the third stage where the user plays the game.
    StateTitle
    Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the first stage where the user can select the skill-level.
    StateWinning
    Class handles the user interaction while the game is in the final stage where the user sees the final screen and can restart the game.
  • Enum Summary 
    Enum Description
    Constants.StateGUI  
    Constants.UserInput  
    Robot.Direction
    Describes all possible directions from the point of view of the robot, i.e., relative to its current forward position.
    Robot.Turn
    Describes all possible turns that a robot can do when it rotates on the spot.
